website_summaries.verdict: If you're looking for affordable, educational fun for your child, this is a good choice – easy to do, informative, and about half the price of similar scientific toys.
pros: 11 chemistry-based experiments that are easy and educational
Youngsters can't get enough of the colorful volcano-like projects
cons: May be too remedial and not very exciting for more advanced or older kids

website_summaries.verdict: A low-priced starter kit for curious young children. Simple science experiments are fun and gratifying.
pros: A fun, low-priced toy with a small footprint
A great introduction to basic kitchen chemistry
cons: Adult supervision definitely helps, especially if the child is very young
You may find yourself supplementing the kit with ingredients from your kitchen

customer_reviews.title: Don't waste your money
customer_reviews.text: The "volcano" was basically a miniature mound that fizzled. Could get a bigger reaction from dropping an Alka Seltzer in water or mixing baking soda with a little vinegar. The "giant crystals" only grew a couple of centimeters. All the experiments are on such a miniature scale it doesn't have any of the wow factor we were looking for. I will go back to googling fun experiments to do with my son.
customer_reviews.author: MomOf3

customer_reviews.title: Kids loved it
customer_reviews.text: This science kit is ok. My kids LOVED it, but to me it was a little redundant. A lot of the experiments had to do with how color changes and growing jiggly crystals... It's not mind blowing, but it was fun for the kids (ages 9 and 5). I bought it for my daughter's birthday, because she wanted a science kit that was on a commercial, that was way more expensive and with way less experiments. I got this as a cheaper alternative that would allow her to do more. I'm very happy I got this kit instead of the one she asked for! I would definitely purchase again and recommend it!
customer_reviews.author: Saffie

customer_reviews.title: If you're looking for a child friendly lab kit, this is it!
customer_reviews.text: This is the most kid friendly and fun lab kit you can get. My kids are ages 2 and 4 and cannot get enough of this. Everything in the kit is high-quality, and this kit lasts a very long time. We have done these experiments over and over for 3 months and only recently have used an entire bag of something. I admit to even being impressed by how cool the activities are. This is worth every single penny. I will 100% be ordering another kit when we deplete all the things in ours.
customer_reviews.author: Cassandra M.

customer_reviews.title: This science kit is perfect for my son
customer_reviews.text: This science kit is perfect for my son. I got it for his 6th birthday and we've been having so much fun doing the experiments. It came with nearly all of the supplies except for simple things you have in your home like baking flour and water. Other kits I've bought have required so many other items which we didn't have, this one is so easy to use. He loves using the test tubes, the dropper, measuring out the components with the scoopers. He said it makes him feel like a real scientist. His 4 year old sister likes doing experiments too. This is the best kit to buy for a young child. So easy for them AND for you.
customer_reviews.author: Jen

customer_reviews.title: Get them experimenting.
customer_reviews.text: My 8 year old had so much fun on Christmas Day with this.
customer_reviews.author: Zelaznog

customer_reviews.title: Nothing "Mind Blowing" about it.
customer_reviews.text: The only thing "Mind Blowing" about this is the price for some basic household ingredients! My 6 y.o. granddaughter was done with it in 15 minutes and exclaimed "Is that it?" very disappointed with the kit. The kit could be a joke routine from Saturday Night Live. Example: color changing water; drop tablets into test tubes, hold tubes up to light, hold one in front of the other - color magically changes, Are you kidding me! Do not buy, you are wasting your time and money.
customer_reviews.author: Lynn T Mavrogenes

customer_reviews.title: Easy to Follow Science Experiments
customer_reviews.text: This is an easy and fun kit to learn about science. Got it for a five year old. The concepts are easy to follow and so are the directions. Everything is pretty much provided in the kit in order to make the science experiments with the exception of some ingredients like vinegar or other acidic ingredients that can be easily found in one's pantry or fridge. You will need one paper plate and some Ziploc bags to store the powders provided after opening the package. For example - baking soda. Overall, we've enjoyed this science kit. My five year old asks to make a science experiment each day! Very fun and educational.
customer_reviews.author: ebe

customer_reviews.title: Poorly designed Science kit
customer_reviews.text: I am surprised they are selling this so called science kit. My niece who is a 4 year old was quite disappointed with it. Nothing interesting in it that will get the kid excited or interested. I am don't know how this product has got 4.5 stars from 1,887 reviews which fooled me into purchasing this useless kit. I will never recommend this to anyone. Waste of money. I will not take it even if they give it free.
customer_reviews.author: Elliott51

customer_reviews.title: Great present for little curious minds
customer_reviews.text: Got this for my 8 year old nephew and it was a big hit! The experiments are short, with results achieved quickly, everything you need is included so there is no need to look or buy extra items and containers like some kits require. The instructions encourage children to make predictions, and really think about what is happening. Adults and children ages 5 - 65 at my sisters had lots of fun observing my nephew do the "magic" lol and there's plenty of material, so experiments can be done over and over.
customer_reviews.author: Live, love, laugh 🖖Top Contributor: Baby

customer_reviews.title: Don’t order this
customer_reviews.text: Very underwhelming once you actually take a look at the back of the box. Some cheap test tubes, q-tips and some ingredients you can buy at the grocery store. Experiments don’t look that interesting either. It’s just quite a let down from the advertising. Bought it for my friend’s kid. I love science and wanted to get him excited about it to, but this kit will not do it. Insult to injury: return shipping is only free if you take it to a staffed amazon return center. Any other type of return will cost half the price of the kit!
customer_reviews.author: S

customer_reviews.title: Recipe for disappointment
customer_reviews.text: The kit is a joke. I supervised my children and step by step we repeated the volcano experiment 3 times thinking we do something wrong. We didn't. It turned out it was actually supposed to be a bit of fizzing and less than impressive color changing. If you want to see your children disappointed that's what you need. It raises a question about great reviews for this product.
customer_reviews.author: dana

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: I was very excited (as was my 4 year old) to get this kit however it did not meet expectations. The experiments are very lack luster. I don't know if my kit is old... but it did not work the way I thought it would from reading the reviews.
customer_reviews.author: Seaside

customer_reviews.title: Awesome product, totally worth checking it out!
customer_reviews.text: My nieces are seven years old and into science. The experiments were easy and straightforward - easily read and done by the kids but adult supervision is probably a good idea. Mind blowing? Not so sure about that but very cool for the budding scientist. Perfect kit to start with. I think it's a cool way to encourage girls to love science and math. Boys will love it too - an exploding volcano! - so it really is great for the whole family. Younger kids could definitely participate with the aforementioned supervision. We LOVED it!
customer_reviews.author: Kali

customer_reviews.title: Good product, horrible packaging
customer_reviews.text: We loved this kit the first time we bought it. Our daughter had a blast with the different experiments and was curious to make up some experiments on her own. However, we ordered it a second time for her friend and the kit came with no box or packaging, and was very damaged and not at all in the condition to be a gift. We are returning it promptly.
customer_reviews.author: BRIAN F

customer_reviews.title: This is just eh
customer_reviews.text: I love that this kit comes with most of the ingredients you will need. But the experiments are totally underwhelming. The colorful box makes it look like you'll be creating these wonderful experiments, but my son has been disappointed almost every time. This was a good launching off point for science instruction, but not something we will use often.
customer_reviews.author: Sarah Keilman

customer_reviews.title: Great product and value!
customer_reviews.text: Bought this as a gift for my almost 5 year old. Great item! He absolutely loves it--asks to do an experiment almost every day--and we've gotten hours of educational family time together. As a parent, I found this easy to administer. All of the ingredients are included--you mainly just supply tap water and a sheet pan to catch drips. Each experiment takes approx 15 minutes. They build progressively, so each reinforces concepts from the earlier ones. All of the experiments have worked exactly as the instructions described. Very happy! Highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Mind Blowing Fun
customer_reviews.text: Every Saturday morning we did a different experiment and had a blast each week. Everything was provided (except, of course, water) which made it really easy to get it going right out of the box. There was no need to run to the supermarket to get ingredients (as with some other kits). The instructions were well written and easy to follow. The supplemental science explanations were a great learning tool. The available YouTube videos let me know what to expect and never did the experiments make a mess. Hands down a great buy.
customer_reviews.author: Dianna Prince

customer_reviews.title: Good for being quarantined at home!
customer_reviews.text: we purchased this for our 8 year old son and he had a lot of fun doing the experiments with his dad! Some of them can get a little messy but nothing major. All included ingredients are packaged nicely but might be best opened by a parent to ensure the stuff inside doesn't go flying! One experiment that our son really enjoyed was the one that shows if a liquid is acidic, neutral or a base . He literally tested every liquid in our entire house! Point being that yes we would recommend this, especially now during the current quarantine when we really need a lot of different stuff for our kids to stay happy and occupied... :-)
customer_reviews.author: Fossati

customer_reviews.title: A fun and safe way to do science experiments.
customer_reviews.text: My 6 year old loves this kit! He has a short attention span and some of the longer experiments have frustrated him, but he loves measuring the different items and putting them in the test tubes. This was well worth the price. As of writing this, we have not completed all of the experiments- each one we have was easy to do and my son was very excited through out the process.
customer_reviews.author: beth

customer_reviews.title: Basic kit
customer_reviews.text: My 5 and 7 year old boys were excited to do the experiments, but we finished all the experiments in less than an hour. Pros: -the simple experiments are laid out for you in an instruction booklet -my kids didn't seem to mind the simplicity and underwhelming results Cons: - the set comes with so little of the materials (acid, base materials) that the results of the experiment are underwhelming - the experiments are actually just the same concept performed in a few different ways - it's worth it for $5-$7, but not $10-$12 which seems to be the going price range
customer_reviews.author: JL

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for kiddos!
customer_reviews.text: This was SO fun for my almost 5YO Godson. I’m in STEM, so I try to find gifts that are relatable to my background for the kiddos in my life. Keep in mind that mom helped and monitored the whole time, but he was so excited to show me his crystals he made. Great kit for a good price. Sure, you can buy everything at the store separate, but this is a good beginners kit with everything included, and you can continue the experiments from there. I highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Courtney Fiebelman

customer_reviews.title: A great beginner’s science kit!
customer_reviews.text: I got this simple kit for my 7 year old grandson’s birthday. He really liked it, but he wanted things to explode. Lol! Although nothing blows up, it is very easy to use and comes with most of the things you need, except a few items you probably already have at home. It’s a great beginner set and there’s not much mess to any of the experiments. My grandson got a lot of enjoyment out of it and it didn’t cost that much. Great for gift giving!
customer_reviews.author: Peter Parker

customer_reviews.title: Good buy
customer_reviews.text: It's a good buy, but be careful if you already have other experiment-type books or kits for your kids. My kids already had another kit of scientific experiments they really enjoyed, so I got this thinking they'd love to do more. Well, almost every experiment is the exact same as the experiments in the other kit they already had. Nothing against this kit, they are still great experiments and great for kids to learn to love science. Just saying to look closely in the description at the experiments included to make sure you aren't duplicating what you already have.
customer_reviews.author: Teresa Kemple

customer_reviews.title: Decent. Wish it comes with a larger portion of ...
customer_reviews.text: Decent. Wish it comes with a larger portion of powders because it ran out after about 5 experiments. Kids spill it a little bit here and there so would be more convenient if sufficient material powders were included.
customer_reviews.author: Zo

customer_reviews.title: Disappointing
customer_reviews.text: Very diappointing. After seeing the great reviews I thought this would be great. Turns out, not many experiments at all and many deal with color changing which my kids already do on their own with paints so it wasn’t so exciting for them.
customer_reviews.author: Meg

customer_reviews.title: Love it and so does a 6 yrs old Kid!
customer_reviews.text: This turned out to be a really good kit. I do wish it came with some more fancy lap stuff but overall very satisfied with the quality of what was included. We got to experimenting as soon as we received it (Sunday Delivery... thank you Amazon!!!) we got to about 4 experiments in about one and a half hours. they do have a list of additional products we may need (except of baking floor and optional food color, everything else is more of coffee filter/paper towel, plates etc which is around the house) Verdict: I loved it so I ordered another one to have shipped to my sister's house for her 7 year old.
customer_reviews.author: Nilam T

customer_reviews.title: Great purchase for exploring/curious minds!
customer_reviews.text: My 7 year old daughter always has questions about how things work so I bought this kit in hopes of giving her the basics of science. She and I both enjoyed the various activities in the included booklet. There were also suggestions to try a certain activity to get bigger results which we both tried to her delight. I would recommend having plastic wrap handy as many things call for that to enlarge experiments. Hope more versions are released :)
customer_reviews.author: Cherita Lofty

customer_reviews.title: Great explorations and discoveries !
customer_reviews.text: This is a terrific product for children to develop natural curiosity as well as nurturing the scientist within! I bought this more than once because each of my grandchildren found the almost empty box, then tried to read what experiments came with it, and would then beg me to buy it again! As a retired teacher, I could see how beneficial it would be as well as how impressed I was that almost everything needed was included in the box!
customer_reviews.author: Debbie Romero

customer_reviews.title: Very underwhelming
customer_reviews.text: My 9 year old, 6 year old, and I have done 4 or 5 of the experiments from this. All three of us were pretty underwhelmed with it. Probably better off just getting slime materials for them and letting them experiment with that. They'll get the same lessons aside from the liquid fizzing part, which is nothing special unless you do it on a larger scale.
customer_reviews.author: Adam

customer_reviews.title: Great for our 6 year old science lover!
customer_reviews.text: Our daughter LOVES this kit! We bought it for her for Christmas, and she received another from her Grandparents as well! Her grandpa (my father-in-law) is a retired middle school teacher and they enjoyed doing the experiments together. Easy and simple clean up and storage. Fun from your basic gifts and she really loved learning WHY things happened!
customer_reviews.author: Three Little Kittens

customer_reviews.title: Great gift for curious children
customer_reviews.text: My daughter is a 9-year-old curious child. Even though she likes any kind of toy, like many kids, she loves to research and find out what happens if... this kit actually helped me to stop the "what if" experiments around the house. The amount of the reactives are appropriate, you can get ideas of continuing helping your children to find out about reactions and what to find in the grocery store if you run out. Actually, I liked it so much. She was really excited when she got it.
customer_reviews.author: A. S. Alvarado

customer_reviews.title: It’s a great start!
customer_reviews.text: It’s cost effective! There’s a variety of experiments and it’s fun! I’ve purchased this three times now. For my 2&3 year old children, and two 5 year olds. I love it, they love it and they enjoy the projects. It’s also safe so an older child can use this on their own. I work in a STEM field and the proper introduction to STEM is important to a child. This is a proper introduction to STEM!
customer_reviews.author: Ken Haygood

customer_reviews.title: It wasn't that great. It was OK.
customer_reviews.text: Eh this kit wasn't that great. The lab booklet was way too much reading my nephew kept getting bored. He enjoyed the experiments when they happened but he was not engaged the entire time by any means and he is a really good kid. He is also 5, and this truly is more meant for a 7 y/o, it's better if they could do the experiments on their own, instead of someone having to do them all. He did enjoy some of them, but I could've come up with better experiments by just going on YouTube.
customer_reviews.author: Kristie

customer_reviews.title: Smart fun
customer_reviews.text: Got this for my 5yr old scientist kid. He loves it! It's fun to do with him and we've both learned a few things. The only things I would change are making the little bags of powder resealable so you don't have to worry about spilling in between experiments. (If you gift this, add some safety glasses and an apron or lab coat- they really add to the fun)
customer_reviews.author: username.789

customer_reviews.title: Great product!
customer_reviews.text: I brought this for my daughter and I to do something together, I decided to record her using it (video to be posted soon, follow, “annacantoo” on IG), although she is much younger than the recommended age she enjoyed doing the experiments with me. There are some experiments that requires household products, so be mindful of that, also make sure you use this on a surface that you don’t mind getting dry, because it gets messy!
customer_reviews.author: Vania R.

customer_reviews.title: Good Value for the Entertainment
customer_reviews.text: My kids are 5 and 7 and were very excited when this showed up. Activities are simple, and kit contains pretty much everything you need. They come together quickly which is good for short attention spans. For the price its a fun, educational activity.
customer_reviews.author: Casual Outdoorsman

customer_reviews.title: Great Intro to Fun Science!
customer_reviews.text: Great starter kit if you're looking for fun science on an intro level. My daughter opened this up Christmas morning, and with all of the toys she received, this is the thing she wanted to open first and she wound up playing with it most of the day. My daughter is nine, and she was able to do most of the experiments independently, although I highly recommend grownup supervision anyway to really slow down the experiments to make room for a little learning, too. The materials are of good quality, and I thought this was well worth the price I paid for it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful product
customer_reviews.text: I was looking for something to pique my 7yo daughter's interest in science. This science kit is perfect! The instructions are thorough; the experiments are fun and educational and the kit comes with EVERYTHING you need. All we've had to provide is water and a tray for spills. My daughter gives it five stars!
customer_reviews.author: mom of 2

customer_reviews.title: A Box Full of Fun and Educational
customer_reviews.text: this science kit for my daughter as a Christmas gift. The kit contains 20 pieces which is perfect for my young (8yo) budding scientist to learn basic science skills. What's In The Box: 2 cotton swabs, 3 test tubes with stand, 3 plastic cups, pipette, 2 sticks, 2 measuring scoops, red cabbage powder, citric acid, baking soda, 3 color tablets, cross linked polyacrylate copolymer, vegetable oil, corn starch, and instruction booklet. This science set has been great for my daughter. She has been eager to try each and every experiment in the book. I purchased this product at full price, with my own money, and the opinions expressed here are my own, and based on my experience.
customer_reviews.author: Lady T

customer_reviews.title: he was excited to do the experiments and very disappointed when we realized that there was no citric acid ...
customer_reviews.text: Got this for my son for Christmas and just opened today, he was excited to do the experiments and very disappointed when we realized that there was no citric acid in our kit and he will have to wait ... frustrating to say the least ...
customer_reviews.author: MOM of toddler boys

customer_reviews.title: Great Deal But Instructions Could Use Pictures!
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this on a lightening deal for my 6 year old son for Christmas. It's a very nice kit that has most of the ingredients required. My son has been fascinated with many of the experiments and we have noticed there are enough ingredients to run a couple of the experiments twice. Minus one star because pictures and/or color in the instruction book would have been a little more helpful for young readers to understand how to work the experiments themselves (with adult supervision of course).
customer_reviews.author: Janellemp

customer_reviews.title: A fun way to interact with children or grandchildren learning about science.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my granddaughters for Christmas. Their parents feel that they do not need more toys or stuff, so I opted to buy something that would get used up but would be fun and interesting. We had a wonderful time doing the experiments together and Their favorite experiment was the underwater volcano. I highly recommend this product and I would love to see more just like it.
customer_reviews.author: Diane D  Kimmel

customer_reviews.title: Bought as Christmas gift for children.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this (and about 60 other "like" items) to hand out to kids at a company Christmas party. You should have seen the excitement when they picked these out. I don't know whether or not they worked, easy or hard, messy or not... but I can tell you it got children excited in a project. I intentionally purchased items that would be fun to do as a family. I would definitely recommend again.
customer_reviews.author: Alex Soper

customer_reviews.title: Great gift
customer_reviews.text: Perfect gift for my five year old. Both my kids love doing these experiments! Fun family night activity and it has everything you need in the box. My son said “this blowed up my mind!” Needless to say I highly recommend these for kiddos as a gift or just because.
customer_reviews.author: Kelsey F

customer_reviews.title: Exciting and Erupting fun!
customer_reviews.text: Great intoduction to Science for my 5 year old! He enjoyed following the instructions and measuring the items into containers, mixing colors and producing erupting volcanos. Exciting and educational as your child learns about the differrnce between acids and bases and their explosive combination. Highly recommend. Adult supervision required.
customer_reviews.author: kimberly Baron

customer_reviews.title: but she did like doing the experiments
customer_reviews.text: When we opened up the box on Christmas Morning it was missing items that were said to be part of the kit. Granddaughter was a little upset but they are items that you can make do with what you have around the house. Not sure if the science knowledge is for a 7 year old, but she did like doing the experiments.
customer_reviews.author: HomeJaymes

customer_reviews.title: Great
customer_reviews.text: My 4 year old absolutely loved this. There are a good amount of experiment options to do with very simple and easy instructions. The amount of supplies they send you seems small but you can do all of these experiments maybe even twice with all the supplies.
customer_reviews.author: Daph C

customer_reviews.title: Easy to replicate with things in your own kitchen after ...
customer_reviews.text: A hit here with my 5yo. Easy to replicate with things in your own kitchen after you run out of the supplied reagents. May need to purchase one or two things (like red cabbage juice powder) but easily obtainable. Experiments were easy for my 5yo to help/participate in. The underwater volcano is the biggest hit thus far. The crystal related experiments were the least impressive/exciting. Would not bother to buy components to redo those. Like that there is a bit of discussion/guidance for parents to talk about the science behind what's going on, but it is a little over a 5yo's head. Easy enough to break it down to easier to understand concepts. Overall glad I bought this kit.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer

customer_reviews.title: I gave this to my 9 year old for Christmas, and she absolutely loves it
customer_reviews.text: I gave this to my 9 year old for Christmas, and she absolutely loves it. My 5 year old is equally excited when we do the experiments, but I do not let either one of them do them on their own, nor would I suggest it given the different chemicals that come with it. There are 11 experiments included, so it is definitely a good value for the cost. Really the only down-side is that all but a few experiments are over quickly, and a couple did not work out very well. However, it got both of my children more interested in science, and taught them a few things along the way, so it was definitely worth it to purchase!
customer_reviews.author: Stef Hamlin

customer_reviews.title: Kids seem to be thrilled
customer_reviews.text: Purchased as a gift for neighbor kids, Christmas. I got them 2 things, neither for specific boy/girl. They opened both and were very excited to see it was a science experiment kit. The young girl (9) was immediately hooked, the boy (6) had already planned his first experiment. The kit shows lots of things in the home to get them started as well.
customer_reviews.author: exflyer

customer_reviews.title: Great Gift for Budding Scientist Grandson
customer_reviews.text: Bought this kit for my 6-year-old grandson's birthday. He told me he plans to become a scientist when he grows up. And this kit did not disappoint. While we were visiting him, he completed several experiments and couldn't wait to do more. Quick note: He did require a parent's help to read the instructions and provide a little guidance. But those were positives in the minds of both parents and child. Great gift. Very pleased.
customer_reviews.author: M. Nelson

customer_reviews.title: and he loved it so much that we had to sit down ...
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my 3-year-old grandson, and he loved it so much that we had to sit down and go through each experiment immediately! He was fascinated. My only complaint is that I think there should have been more things included so that the experiments could have been done more than once. However, it was great to see a little one so interested in science. (He says he will be a scientist when he grows up.)
customer_reviews.author: ArleneFL

customer_reviews.title: My boys (age 7 and 9) absolutely LOVE this kit
customer_reviews.text: My boys (age 7 and 9) absolutely LOVE this kit. They have fairly short attention spans, but I am shocked at how long they will sit and do experiments! One typically reads the instructions while the other mixes everything. The ingredients are basic household items, which is great because I can easily refill the items from the grocery store when they run out. I considered skipping the kit and just buying the items myself, but then I would miss out on all of the different experiments as well as the "tools" that they get (beakers, tiny spoons, etc.). Definitely worth it - and for such a great price, it's a win-win.
customer_reviews.author: Lori M

customer_reviews.title: Missing more than half of the contents
customer_reviews.text: I was really excited about this kit and have been trying to stock up on neat things to do with the kids so the price was great for the number of activities. But when I opened it, less than half of the listed contents were in the package. I would like to get ahold of the manufacturer but even the booklet that should've come with it is missing-where I'm guessing the customer service number is.
customer_reviews.author: Zack Perry

customer_reviews.title: Great present for you g scientists
customer_reviews.text: I gave this to my niece as a Christmas present as she is a young scientist at heart and loves science stuff more than regular toys. She loved this! She’s still playing with it and her mom has found more supplies so that my niece can keep using materials that were in this kit.
customer_reviews.author: Marcela

customer_reviews.title: You need to purchase other items to make it work
customer_reviews.text: I bought this because my 7 year old loves science. You need a lot of extra things to do the experiments which I currently don't have and keep forgetting to pick up at the store. It was cheap to purchase but know you will be spending more on other items just to use this. So a $10 item is more like $20 after you go to the store. I will probably update this review once we actually get to use it. Its cute but not worth 5 stars.
customer_reviews.author: DOT

customer_reviews.title: 7 & 4 year old grandsons
customer_reviews.text: We decided to make this a "Stem" Christmas...toys related to Science, Technology, Engineering & Mathematics...and this was a hit with our 7 & 4 year old grandsons. It was 1 of 5 related toys they received....and it was evidently a great idea.
customer_reviews.author: Dawn In Houston, TXTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: Great Kid Gifts
customer_reviews.text: I bought several of these to give away as gifts to some of the kids. They were a hit and everyone loved them. The kids were able to disconnect from the electronic toys and enjoy some science in a fun way, while also learning! Win Win!
customer_reviews.author: K. Loria

customer_reviews.title: Pretty good kit although most of it is very similar ...
customer_reviews.text: Pretty good kit although most of it is very similar (acid base with the cabbage powder). Experiments were easy to do and very enjoyable for my nieces (6 and 4). They wanted more of a "rainbow" because of the pictures on the front, but that isn't really feasible with the supplies. Very cute test tubes that can be used for lots of different experiments moving forward as well.
customer_reviews.author: JP

customer_reviews.title: Science Class in a Box
customer_reviews.text: I homeschool a very smart 5 year old and am always seeking the right balance of information versus hands on activities that she needs exposure too. This box is everything I could ask for and more. Our Spring Science Class : planned.
customer_reviews.author: Courtney Reeves

customer_reviews.title: No box - only a ziploc.
customer_reviews.text: This didn’t even have a box when it arrived - the contents were jammed into a ziplock bag.... seriously. Nothing else.... like it was used. Never order this.
customer_reviews.author: Lorna P.

customer_reviews.title: Niece is excited but upon opening realized it’s pretty simple to make your own kit
customer_reviews.text: Rally simple things inside. Box is lot more colorful than what’s inside. I found it to be kind of expensive for what it is, but my niece was excited about it. She hasn’t used it yet so I can’t speak about the actual experiments inside. Will update review later
customer_reviews.author: Beezy

customer_reviews.title: Really cool!
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this set for my five year old son. It’s very neat and I’d totally use it for gifts. There are 11 projects in the box. There are things that you will need to supply yourself, however, most of them are items you can find at home in the pantry, such as, baking flour, and such. Activities include a colorful volcano, writing in invisible ink so they’re very beginner science projects. I’d definitely recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Ejbess

customer_reviews.title: Great fun and learning!!!
customer_reviews.text: I have done this kit many times with my younger grandkids and older grandkids love to do it independently! Great science kit for the beginner or enthusiast!!! I have bought eight so far!!!
customer_reviews.author: Lisa J. Burgé

customer_reviews.title: Fun and easy
customer_reviews.text: Super easy to use and fosters deeper thinking by leading the child to think what will happen if one aspect of the experiment is changed. Almost everything you will need is included in the box. A few experiments do call for something we had in the kitchen. Very easy to get the child excited about science and about learning. I used this with a 6 year old and a 9 year old.
customer_reviews.author: ginarae

customer_reviews.title: We have made the volcano and the kids loved it. Anything to get them excited for science
customer_reviews.text: This kit is very cute and affordable. We bought 3 kits because it was so affordable. We have made the volcano and the kids loved it. Anything to get them excited for science. The volcano experiment was simple and the kids enjoyed watching the reaction. We did have to provide flour for this experiment and some of the other ones do require extra items. Overall a great kit and would make a great gift for kids 10 and under
customer_reviews.author: barbara margolies

customer_reviews.title: Disapointing...
customer_reviews.text: We were a little disappointed in this gift. It has many experiments and we have only tried a few, but they were boring and did not react as expected. Unless the other experiments are better, I am sticking with a low review.
customer_reviews.author: Brandy

customer_reviews.title: The kids loved playing with this
customer_reviews.text: The kids loved playing with this. Minor adult supervision is needed. My 7 year old and his friends figured most of it outo n their own and I just lept an eye on them
customer_reviews.author: Cass

customer_reviews.title: GREAT gift idea
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this for my niece who is 9 and is a budding scientist. My sister says that she has been doing experiments EVERYDAY! This is HOURS of entertainment. The kids are NEVER bored. I thought that the parents would have to be proficient in science for this gift but that is not the case. My sister doesn't even like science, but she helps with these experiments.
customer_reviews.author: YWChula

customer_reviews.title: Not as advertised
customer_reviews.text: Advertises some experiments on the box that are not included in the materials or the instruction manual, really upset my kids...the experiments it does include are very simple to do.
customer_reviews.author: Katie S.

customer_reviews.title: Well worth the price and age appropriate 6-10.
customer_reviews.text: The 6 and 8yr old kids loved it. Monitor if they have very young siblings. This is what I remember doing as a kid 60 years ago: foaming volcanoes, magic color changes....
customer_reviews.author: JB

customer_reviews.title: Educational and fun for Littles
customer_reviews.text: I got this for my 7 year old God son and he loved it! No sooner did he open up the gift did he take it out and start experimenting. It seems educational while still being fun and attention grabbing for the kiddos. It didn't seem too messy either. He was able to do a couple experiments himself and kept it in a plate to keep it contained
customer_reviews.author: Amanda

customer_reviews.title: Great present
customer_reviews.text: Got this for my 7 year old for Christmas. We've spent the entire day playing around with it making things and experimenting. Hes in awe of every chemical reaction we've made so far. I wish there were a little more to it but you cant beat it for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Kayla Queen

customer_reviews.title: Underwhelming, not mind blowing
customer_reviews.text: This may be a good introduction to science for parents and kids who are just venturing in for the first time. The experiments can be easily found and put together without the kit. The quantities included in this kit are minuscule and somewhat disappointing. For example- the volcano explosion is formed by a teaspoon amount of powder (the “volcano”) and a drop of liquid. My daughter and her friend kept asking “where is the volcano?” I love the idea of exploring science without a lot of prep, but this kit was not that great.
customer_reviews.author: Penelope

customer_reviews.title: BEST GIFT EVER!!!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this gift for my 6-year old Granddaughter. I read each experiment's direction and she performed each task. It was perfect!!! She loved each project and looked forward to every event. I highly recommend this gift!! Was worth EVERY cent!!!
customer_reviews.author: CP4760

customer_reviews.title: FIRST BOX OIL LEAKED
customer_reviews.text: Returned easily at Whole Foods/Amazon and reordered. It was vegetable oil that is included but it leaked on the directions. That was the hard part no experiments could happen. Perhaps bag directions. Nice gift.
customer_reviews.author: PJ

customer_reviews.title: 5 year olds favorite & asked for weekly
customer_reviews.text: 5 year old loves these experiments and it’s great shared fun and educational. Opens up world of other “Experiments” 5-1/2 year old constantly asks to do experiments. One of her favorite activities. Terrific introduction to science - highly recommend. Adult supervision is required.
customer_reviews.author: tiger65

customer_reviews.title: Addiction
customer_reviews.text: My 11 year old has spent hours experimenting on all 11 experiments. She would followed the directions and then changed it up. She asked questions and came up with her own hypothesis. Hands down a great gift of kids that love science
customer_reviews.author: K.B.

customer_reviews.title: Fun for the Whole Family
customer_reviews.text: Our 4 year old daughter absolutely LOVES this science kit. It has been a fun activity for all of us to do as a family as well. We’ve also been able to do a handful of experiments more then once too because they give you a good amount of everything. Great value and fun for us all. We have a few 4 & 5 year old bday parties to attend this summer & each of them will be receiving a science kit. :)
customer_reviews.author: Teresa M

customer_reviews.title: It's such fun learning experience
customer_reviews.text: My 4 yo loves this!! It's such fun learning experience. Love that most experiments I can continue with my own supplies once I run out of the ones it comes with. Definitely recommend this to parents with young kids.
customer_reviews.author: ES

customer_reviews.title: Fun but will be better if has more variety
customer_reviews.text: Most of them are color changing experiments. Less types than expected. And a few items can be found in kitchen. It would be fun for little kids, but it would be helpful if instruction has pictures as little ones may not be able to read all the words.
customer_reviews.author: RainbowDash2019

customer_reviews.title: Lots of Science Fun
customer_reviews.text: This has been a great hit with my grandsons ages 3 and 5. They enjoy the experiments and we make videos so we can watch and discuss. (Sorry, I am a chemistry teacher and it is just what I do.) They really like that they can do some of the experiment themselves but it does require an adult to supervise and help stay on the operating protocol. Anything that was not in the kit was handy in the kitchen. It can be messy so be sure to protect surfaces. We have a big plastic tray.
customer_reviews.author: Susan

customer_reviews.title: Easy to follow direction & FUN
customer_reviews.text: Purchased as a birthday gift for my 5 year old. She LOVED it. There were 1 or 2 experiments that lost her attention since they take an hour or so to complete but all the others were perfect. She was able to do all the measurements her self and see the experiments play out. Fun first introduction to chemistry.
customer_reviews.author: Toni B.

customer_reviews.title: Convenient and easy to use
customer_reviews.text: We haven't done many of these experiments yet but all the pieces were there. You could probably replicate most of these experiments without buying the kit but having the instructions and ingredients packaged together makes it more fun and convenient.
customer_reviews.author: Scott

customer_reviews.title: Great, easy to follow instructions, all natural science project kit
customer_reviews.text: I gave this to my grandson, who is 10 for a summer project. We all had fun doing the experiments. The one he liked the best, was the color changing volcano. What I like most about this Kit, that everything was included, and all the ingredients were natural products that you probably have in your kitchen. Also, The instructions were easy to follow, and very clear for him to read. Thank you for a wonderful science project for children
customer_reviews.author: Donna K.

customer_reviews.title: Fun stufff!
customer_reviews.text: My 7 year old loved being a little scientist and trying out all of the fun little labs. It is a great thing to have laying around on a rainy day and do. Came on time. I would highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Ashley C

customer_reviews.title: Fun for younger kids
customer_reviews.text: This was great for my 8 year old daughter. We were able to get at least an hours worth of entertainment from this. The experiments were not very complex but she could do them herself. I only wish there was more variety in the types of experiments. They all consisted of mixing a combination of the same 6 powdered ingredients and watching the reactions.
customer_reviews.author: Jackie Thomas

customer_reviews.title: Junior sciences in training
customer_reviews.text: I bought this item from my son who was eight at the time. He enjoyed it very much it actually does require adult assistance but that was fine. It was cool to see the experiments happen and to see that we did them right! I definitely suggest this as a weekend project just to go through the book with your kids and do each experiment because it opens their eyes so much.
customer_reviews.author: Nanner

customer_reviews.title: Worth buying
customer_reviews.text: This is a very basic chemistry set with a few acid base reactions and standard kid stuff. I did one experiment each day with my 4 year old for about a week. She looked forward to it. It was worth 16 bucks.
customer_reviews.author: Fake account 27

customer_reviews.title: Great for kids!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this gift for a 6 year old I nanny loves math and science - this gift was perfect for her. This kit comes equipped with 11 interactive experiments that provide quality educational time with your children. Although this kit does require adult supervision and help, it is a great hands on learning experience for children of all ages! One of my biggest complaints of this product is the lack of explanation of the experiments. I often found my self searching the internet for answers to the 6 year old's questions. Overall great product! I would definitely consider buying it for other children that I know to foster an interest in science!
customer_reviews.author: AGoodman

customer_reviews.title: Bringing magic back into the life of children
customer_reviews.text: my 12 year old nephew told his 6 year old sister “magic isn’t real.” She was crushed. I told her magic was just science. So I bought her this for Christmas. She wanted to play with it right away. The color changing volcano really got my nephews attention. He proclaimed “how’d it do that!” To which my Niece responded “its magic!!” We ended up using all the ingredients that day, but most of it is pantry staples. I told my sister to keep the book for their school science fairs.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Amazing kit for aspiring scientist!
customer_reviews.text: This science kit was well packaged and easy to use, it was also VERY kid friendly. Most of the experiments have everything needed when the kit is purchased with the exception of water. Our son loves to watch things change and interact and this kit opened up his eyes and provided so much excitement! Even our youngest who is under 2 enjoyed watching what happened every time we did the underwater volcano. The instructions were so clear, concise, and simple to follow with huge results. I would definitely recommend this kit to anyone.
customer_reviews.author: AFAM7

customer_reviews.title: Really cool activity to do with your kiddos!!!!
customer_reviews.text: Really a cool thing to do with your little ones!! My five-year-old son and I really enjoy doing the experiments together. My two-year-old son likes to get in on the action, too, but one does need to, of course, be very careful, even around the older kids! I like getting it out when my husband is home, so he can tend to the other kids 😍
customer_reviews.author: Katie Hopson

customer_reviews.title: KIDS HAD A BLAST!
customer_reviews.text: KIDS LOVED THIS! SO FAR WE'VE DONE 2 EXPERIMENTS. MAKE SURE KIDS WASH THEIR HANDS EVEN IF THEY DIDN'T DO THE EXPERIMENT. WE HAVE A RUINED COUCH BECAUSE SOMEHOW SOME OF THE INGREDIENTS WENT FROM FINGERS TO COUCH AND IT RUINED THE COUCH BEYOND FIXING. LOL. THEY HAD SO MUCH FUN AND WANTED TO DO ALL THE EXPERIMENTS AGAIN AND AGAIN.
customer_reviews.author: BB

customer_reviews.title: Great fun for younger children.
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely love this kit. I would not recommend this particular kit for older children who may get a little bored, but with its simple instructions and experiments its perfect for younger children. My son who is 5 has learned quite a bit and enjoys these kid friendly activities. Even my daughter (3) enjoys watching. I will be buying other science kits from this company in the future.
customer_reviews.author: Jessica

customer_reviews.title: Back-to-School Gift
customer_reviews.text: I bought this as a back-to-school gift for a friend 's little boy who loves science. She said he loved it. I like that the ingredients for the experiments are easy to find so they can repeat if they wish😊.
customer_reviews.author: Lisa R.

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic birthday present for my seven-year-old
customer_reviews.text: We got this for my daughter's seventh birthday. I felt the experiments were very age-appropriate and interesting for her. She has had a blast with the first experiment we did. She already had a couple other items like a beaker and a measuring cup. The only thing keeping me from giving this more than four stars is that I would expect it to have a few more science tools in it .
customer_reviews.author: G Team

customer_reviews.title: Everything in the box..but could use more experiments.
customer_reviews.text: Kids 4 and 7 love it but there are not many experiments in here - you can do them all in 1-2 days! i had to pace my kids because we did almost all in 1 day! I did like that just about everything was included in the box and everything else is everyday household items. Not bad at all for a starter set.
customer_reviews.author: Dawn Basnight

customer_reviews.title: Great for birthday gifts
customer_reviews.text: This is the best science kit for kids. We often use this kit as the go to birthday present since it is a unique gift that the kids can get into and perform experiments that open the world to them. Many of the experiments come with enough supplies to redo 2 or three times.
customer_reviews.author: Love the Family

customer_reviews.title: Gift 10 yr old Boy
customer_reviews.text: I’m gifting this to a ten year old boy and I’m excited to give it to him. I think he’ll enjoy it. It looks super nice and it isn’t super light (I was worried it would be like super light and cheapish for 11 activities to be inside lol)
customer_reviews.author: Sam&Bryan

product_meta.title: Scientific Explorer My First Mind Blowing Science Kids Science Experiment Kit
product_meta.description:
Scientific Explorer My First Mind Blowing Science Kit is your junior chemist’s introduction to the world of scientific exploration. Learn the basics of science from chemical reactions to the use of science tools. With mind blowing experiments such as creating a sunset in a test tube and making a color-changing volcano, children will love learning fascinating facts about their natural world and this kit will keep them engrossed with interactive experiments. Includes Red cabbage powder, citric acid, baking soda, 3 color tablets, crosslinked polyacrylate copolymer, vegetable oil, corn starch, 2 cotton swabs, 3 test tubes with stand, 3 plastic cups, pipette, 2 sticks, 2 measuring scoops and activity guide. Recommended for children 6 years of age and older with adult supervision.

AMAZON.COM
Scientific Explorer's Mind Blowing Science Kit makes it possible to create your very own science lab at home. This smartly designed science kit allows young scientists to perform several amazing science experiments that range from erupting a color-changing volcano to growing colorful, jiggly crystals. Young scientists will learn about basic principles behind the science including the difference between acids and bases, and how to use a test tube and pipette. Although designed for use by children ages four and older, adult supervision is needed for safety and to ensure that young scientists get the most out of the Mind Blowing Science Kit.

 

Mind Blowing Science Kit
Ages: 4 years and up
Requires: Water, baking flour, plate or tray, tape, red and blue pens, grape juice, coffee filter paper, bowl, measuring spoons and cups, stirring spoon, towels for clean-up



What We Think
Fun factor: 
Durability: 
Ease of assembly: 
Educational factor: 
Novelty factor: 

The Good: Colorful experiments can be performed at home

The Challenging: Adult supervision is required at all times

In a Nutshell: A fun, dynamic way to learn about science


This kit comes equipped with almost everything you need to create mind-blowing, colorful experiments in the comfort of your own kitchen. View larger. Do-It-Yourself Science: No Experts Required
Scientific Explorer's Mind Blowing Science Kit includes almost everything you need to set up exciting, colorful experiments with your young scientist. Included in this dynamic kit are the following components: red cabbage juice powder, citric acid, color tablets, polyacrylamide crystals, a pipette, small and medium scoops, and three plastic cups. Only basic supplies are required but not included, such as water, towels, a plate or tray to catch spills, and a stirring spoon. Although none of the experiments included in this kit are especially messy, each one should be done on a flat surface that can be easily wiped clean in case of spills. Adults who are supervising experiments do not need to be science gurus. In addition to step-by-step instructions for each experiment, the detailed science guide included with this kit provides adults with "mind blowing science secrets" that help to answer questions about what's happening in each experiment. All of the materials and experiments involve basic scientific concepts associated with acidic and basic liquids and are arranged to present these concepts in sequential order. The descriptions included in the science guide give background information related to each reaction and offer questions that adults can ask to help encourage fun learning during experimentation. 

 Dynamic, Fun Science at Home
Adults and kids will learn amazing new things about basic and acidic solutions with the Mind Blowing Science Kit. Whether erupting a color-changing volcano, creating a sunset in a test tube, or growing colorful, jiggly crystals, this science kit mixes learning with experimentation in a fun and colorful way for a wide range of ages. Each of the hands-on activities in the science guide is intended to be performed by a young scientist under adult supervision, although these activities can be adjusted to accommodate a range of ages and capabilities while still maintaining the educational excitement of the original experiments. In addition to providing detailed instructions, the science guide makes it possible for those adults who might not have a background in science, or even any exposure to scientific experimentation, to knowledgably perform experiments successfully. The dynamic, colorful nature of the experiments included in this kit make it great for pleasing a crowd at family gatherings, parties, or science fairs.

 What's in the Box
Red cabbage juice powder, citric acid, baking soda, color tablets, cross-linked polyacrylamide crystals, vegetable oil, corn starch, paper, cotton swabs, test tubes and caps, plastic cups, pipette, stir sticks, small and medium plastic scoops, science guide.
feature_bullets: 20 piece kit allows your young scientist to explore and learn the basics of science from chemical reactions to the use of science tools
Represents STEM (Science, Technology, Engineering, Math) principles – open ended toys to construct, engineer, explorer and experiment
Chemicals Included: Red cabbage powder, citric acid, baking soda, 3 color tablets, crosslinked polyacrylate copolymer, vegetable oil, corn starch
Supplies Included: 2 cotton swabs, 3 test tubes with stand, 3 plastic cups, pipette, 2 sticks, 2 measuring scoops and activity guide
Recommended for children 6 years of age and older with adult supervision
